snippet: Thomas Gutowski, who secured a low-income apartment in a Trump-owned building through a lottery, has fought substance abuse and illness to rebuild his life and keep his home.
abstract: Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of the agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Thomas Gutowsk of Manhattan with living expenses as he continues to rebuild his life while recovering from substance abuse.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Gutowski, who secured a low-income apartment in a Trump-owned building through a lottery, has fought substance abuse and illness to rebuild his life and keep his home.

headline.seo: Former Drug Addict Clings to His Lucky Address
headline.main: After Job Loss, Ex-Addict Faces Illness, but Clings to His Lucky Address
headline.print_headline: After Job Loss, Ex-Addict Faces Illness, but Clings to His Lucky Address
